thread.title_full: Don't Let Anyone Tell You THIS Was a Peaceful Protest | The Joe Pags Show | WMMB-AM

title: Don't Let Anyone Tell You THIS Was a Peaceful Protest | The Joe Pags Show | WMMB-AM
text:
Don't Let Anyone Tell You THIS Was a Peaceful Protest posted by The Joe Pags Show - 1 hour ago share It is simply inaccurate to describe the riots as “mostly peaceful” or even as a “protest.” Last night, Milo Yiannopoulos was forced to cancel a planned speech at the University of California-Berkely. Protesters forced Yiannopoulos to evacuate from the campus. 
IJR.com put together a list of a few of the disturbing acts of violence that took place during the protest. Black bloc vandals smash windows of Mechanics Bank on Shattuck in Berkeley after #Milo event shut down at#UCBerkeley pic.twitter.com/PwqjhRBb5u — Nanette Asimov (@NanetteAsimov) February 2, 2017 At UC Berkeley, windows and ATMs have been broken at Wells Fargo and Chase in protest of Milo Yiannopoulos. #MiloAtCal h/t: @GillianNBC pic.twitter.com/1tHItXEl7p — Jacob Goldstein (@GoldsteinStreet) February 2, 2017 BREAKING: 'Antifa' rioters at UC Berkeley smash windows of Wells Fargo, smash ATMs, throw flare inside building... #MiloAtCal pic.twitter.com/pcbid537vt — John Binder  (@JxhnBinder) February 2, 2017 The #miloatcal protest is back on @UCBerkeley campus. Every window at this @Starbucks smashed. @nbcbayarea pic.twitter.com/QzQLOi20Q0 — Raquel Maria Dillon (@RaquelMDillon) February 2, 2017 Tree is now on fire at UC Berkeley #MiloAtCal #UCBerkeley . People keep shouting "it's lit!" pic.twitter.com/ypgu6D3T4t — Gillian Edevane (@GillianNBC) February 2, 2017 WOAH. Protestors blocked car in Berkeley. Driver ran them over. Sped off. #Milo pic.twitter.com/GeVVphFxjd — Michael Bodley (@michael_bodley) February 2, 2017 Heard 5-8pm Central the Joe Pags Show has been a San Antonio staple and a fan favorite since 2007. Pags started his career in radio in 1989 in Palm Beach County, Florida before making his way to the TV anchor desk in Saginaw/Flint, Grand Rapids/Kalamazoo, and Lansing, Michigan then moving on to New York. From there he was called back to radio and landed at the Clear Channel Talk Flagship, WOAI in 2005. Pags has won multiple Associated Press awards for excellence in journalism in both Michigan and New York. Michigan Association of Broadcasting award-winner and has been cited by the US House of Representatives and the State of Michigan for his broadcasts following the attacks of 9/11. The show is nationally syndicated to more than 70 stations and is seen on NewsmaxTV nationally. Along with his syndicated daily show, Pags hosts Premiere’s nationally syndicated “The Weekend w/Joe Pags.” Pags is a member of Talkers Magazine’s “Heavy Hundred,” and his show was recently named to the NewsMax list of the most influential local talk shows in the country.
